boardgame.name: Roman Disaster at Teutoburg
boardgame.description:
You are Publius Quinctilius Varus, governor of the province of Germania. For three days now, rebel Germanic tribesmen have been attacking your three marching legions. Will your military command expertise, along with the help of your legates and centurions, be enough to escape this latest ambush?

Roman Disaster at Teutoburg is Vol II in the C3i Good to Go Series from RBM Studio. These simple solitaire mini-dice rolling games are fitted to be played in small spaces (on a kitchen table, a hotel room, on a train or plane) in less than 20 to 30 minutes. They illustrate an historical action but they are not a simulation. The purpose of these games is to challenge the player to make the right decisions while having a quick and fun game.

Designed by Pascal Toupy, Roman Disaster at Teutoburg is a bonus stand-alone solitaire game inside C3i Magazine Nr35 published by RBM Studio.

boardgame.name: Shaintar Adventure Deck
boardgame.description:
Shaintar Adventure Cards - Epic High Fantasy for Your Adventure Deck

Add these Shaintar-specific Adventure Cards to your existing Savage Worlds Adventure Deck to seriously ramp up the Epic High Fantasy aspects of your game. 6 pages with 27 new cards that bring that special Shaintar flair to your game table, cranking everything up to the action fantasy adventure cinema experience that defines this setting.

Examples include:


Chosen of the Horn - Indicating a huge moment when the Silver Unicorn takes notice of your Heroes and brings them great comfort.
I Don't Think So - Shut down the GM's attempt to save a particularly ugly bad guy!
That Was a Big Boom! - Make that damaging spell just that much uglier.
The Interloper - The Raven takes note of your group, bringing them great favor, but promising even more trouble ahead.


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Night Sky
boardgame.description:
The night sky is divided into 88 Constellations. From those 88 Constellations, Asterisms are created as additional patterns. You and your fellow astral cartographers will map the night sky in this roll and write family friendly game. Each Constellation and Asterism card contains details about the pattern, providing for an educational experience as well.

On each player's turn, they will roll all of the dice. The active player is the only one to use the larger dice to plot a star. All of the other players, including the active player, will choose from the three smaller dice by picking two numbers for their chart coordinates and one for its research value.

The Constellation and Asterism cards have their own mapping patterns you must draw in your grid. As you complete cards, you earn victory points and other bonus actions.

Your research area is where you will use one die per turn to advance your equipment and funding resources.

Rounds are based on the number of players and final scoring is tallied from your completed constellations and asterisms, as well as any funding you have unlocked in your research hub.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: 100 Knick-Knacks for Pugmire
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb

This is a collection of minor items that could be found in the possession of NPCs, or perhaps given to a PC when they are created. None have any definite value or meaning, unless the Guide decides otherwise, though some can be considered to be wonders. They can be used as oddities to spark ideas or could be something to be investigated further.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

Parchment with a map showing an area that looks to be deep in the Fearful Forest.
Patched and mended stuff toy that now resembles no known creature, even if it ever did.
Piece of a Whisperwood branch, carved with protective symbols.
Piece of polished rock containing what looks like a spiral shell, also made of rock.
Piece of polished wood that has been carved with strange symbols and the entirety covered in a clear, damage-resistant coating.

boardgame.name: Cuba Libre: Calixto Bot Update Pack
boardgame.description:
The Cuba Libre Calixto bot update pack brings the successful Jacquard bot system to Cuba Libre. Like its predecessors in Gandhi and Fall of Saigon, Calixto is quick to use and easy to implement but presents a challenge to any Cuba Libre player.
When selecting Operations and Special Activities, cards are drawn from the Calixto deck—there are six cards for each Cuba Libre faction. Each card examines the current state of the game and selects the appropriate action for the active faction. A single, faction-specific table then determines where that action will occur. The same table is used to select spaces for Operations, Special Activities, and Events, minimizing the need to flip between multiple player aids.

Playing against Calixto feels like playing against a human opponent. It is unpredictable yet responsive to strategic needs, it goes after its enemies while keeping an eye on its ally, and makes moves until now limited to human players—like choosing a Limited Operation to block an opponent’s Event. Calixto can take the place of any faction in a Cuba Libre session and can be used in any combination of player and non-player setups.

boardgame.name: One Shot First
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Adventures and sourcebook for the Savareen Sector.
...
The Savareen sector, the gateway to the Outer Rim, sits on the border of the Mid Rim and on the heart of the Corellian Run. Those that come in are taking their first steps into the true galactic outback, where the rule of law – and the hand of governments – is a little bit lighter, the technology is a little bit more suspect, and the danger is a little bit higher.

boardgame.name: Operational Costs
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Running a ship is not simply a case of buying one and flying into the sunset. They all require certain things: Fuel, Power and Maintenance in order to function, and running a ship requires certain factors to be taken into account, like the mass of the cargo load, the strain on the systems, number of passengers and the consumables each vessel needs to support its crew.

boardgame.name: People, Places and Plots of Corellia
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This supplement is intended for use with Star Wars: Edge of the Empire. It is a collection of [materials previously published as a blog].

boardgame.name: People, Places and Plots of Hutt Space
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This supplement is intended for use with Star Wars: Edge of the Empire. It is a collection of [materials previously published as a blog].

boardgame.name: People, Places and Plots of Tatooine
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This supplement is intended for use with Star Wars: Edge of the Empire. It is a collection of [materials previously published as a blog].

boardgame.name: The City of Mos Shuuta
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Mos Shuuta is a small city on the desert world of Tatooine, situated on the top of a tall, rocky bluff, with nothing but endless sand in every direction around it.

boardgame.name: The Mandalorian War Machine
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Mandalorians' actions throughout history are not easily forgotten by their victims. For a long time they were the third, unpredictable, side of the largest conflicts in Republic history, the other two being the Jedi and Sith of course.

The Mandalorians have allied themselves with the Sith on many occasions, but it would be misguided to see them as lackeys of them, or believe that they share the same goals. Perhaps their methods coincide on many occasions – hence their alliances – but where the Sith seek power and domination in the hands of themselves, the Mandalorians seek conflict, strength and honour. They initialised assimilation of others into their own – superior? – culture.

boardgame.name: The Yirt
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

At the end of the Clone Wars, the CIS Banking Clan Frigate, San Nalaor, arrived at a hidden CIS cybernetics research station “Outpost Peth” in the uninhabited Singla System. The San Nalaor had orders to evacuate the scientists and remaining technology off the outpost. Unbeknownst to them, Republic (now Imperial) agents had recently received the coordinates of the research station.

boardgame.name: Thick Skinned - A Guide to Hutt Politics
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is designed to take players along the plans of Bargos the Hutt’s plans for revenge against another Hutt that wronged him. Bargos the Hutt is a NPC from the adventure supplied in with the Edge of Empire Game Masters Kit. It takes the lead from that and creates opportunities for the party to expand working with Bargos to exact his revenge in a way any good crime boss would.

boardgame.name: Environmental Set Pieces
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A series of short encounters that prominently feature extreme environmental conditions.

boardgame.name: Fires of Resistance
boardgame.description:
An Unofficial Era Sourcebook

From the introduction:

Abednedo were a sentient species native to the planet of the same name in the Colonies region of the Galaxy. Abednedo were humanoid and mammalian, and their face featured dangling mouth tendrils and two fleshy nostrils. Abednedos were brown, cream or tan in color. They were a common sight in the galaxy, and were found in multiple, contrasting professions. Notable Abednedo included Resistance pilot Ello Asty, Rebel Alliance tech specialist Antrot and senator Brasmon Kee of Abednedo.

boardgame.name: Genesys and the Force
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Upon release of Genesys Core Rulebook, some fans of Star Wars (FFG) have expressed a desire to play a Star Wars game in the ruleset of Genesys. Most of the content already translates perfectly, with one exception: the absence of the Star Wars Force die and the implementation of the Force talent trees. It's more pragmatic just to simplify play in the already awesome Star Wars systems that have been tried and true rulesets for years now.

Pragmatism is fine and all, but it doesn't address the problem itself. So I decided to address the problem.

boardgame.name: Heroic Abilities (for Star Wars)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Player characters are heroes, with unique capabilities that set them apart from the ordinary inhabitants of the galaxy. When you create your Star Wars character, you also choose a Heroic Ability for your character during Step 4 of character creation. Each player character has only one Heroic Ability, which helps set them apart as a hero. As your character grows in experience, they receive ability points, which you spend on upgrades that further customize your character’s Heroic Ability.

boardgame.name: Genesys Talents to be Used as Unique Abilities for Star Wars
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

These talents are found in various publications for Genesys. I have slightly tweaked these for use in the Star Wars system (mostly just replacing certain skills where appropriate). These talents are not found in the Star Wars system’s Specialization Trees.

boardgame.name: House Rules [for FFG Star Wars]
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A collection of House Rules & Optional Rules for use in Fantasy Flight’s Star Wars line of Role-Playing Games. These add additional rules, alter rules or enhance existing rules.

boardgame.name: Races & Feats Pack 1
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Five new races and eighteen feats from Nat19's "Vestige of Opiuchus."

boardgame.name: Incredible Creatures
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

We turned the tables on creature creation by beginning with artists instead of writers.

This book includes 32 pieces of original creature art which a small army of writers then used as inspiration for nearly 140 brand new creatures ready for your fifth edition game!

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Dwarf Ref - Races of Amoverek
boardgame.description: From axe-weilding mountain dwarves to seven dwarves to magical dwarves, the dwarves bring brute force and the unexpected into fantasy, mythology, and even a few romance fiction games and other media.

boardgame.name: Gamecraft
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You're independent game designers trying to get you work to be noticed in a saturated market: craft on!

boardgame.name: Olympe
boardgame.description:
In this game, the trump is defined by the color of the god played by the player who engages the trick.

Let’s imagine our player, playing as Artemis (whose color is purple), played a purple card. They are playing their own color, so they are playing the trump suit.
Other players have to provide purple and have to rise (to play a higher value card). If they cannot rise, they have to play a lower value card, and if they don’t have any purple card either, they must discard any card from their hand.
Now let’s imagine our first player, still Artemis, playing yellow. Other players have to provide the lead suit (yellow), but they don’t have to rise, since it's no longer the trump suit.

Another exemple: a first player doesn’t have a yellow card, they must ruff with a purple card and therefore start the next trick.
New situation: a second player doesn’t have a yellow card, either they have a trump suit card and must over-ruff (play a higher value card from the trump suit), or under-ruff if they have only lower value ones (play a lower value card from the trump suit). If they don’t have any card from the trump suit, they must discard any card from their hand.


The player with the higher value card wins the trick.

There are special cards in each suit: the Monsters which can cancel a trick under certain conditions and the Heroes who disables the Monsters.

Scoring:
At the end of the round, the players count the points they scored during it.
The player with the most point gets 3 gems, the second only one, and the others take none.
The first one with 12 gems wins the game, and become the new god of gods.

–description from the rulebook

boardgame.name: Lanzarote La Geria
boardgame.description:
Lanzarote La Geria is a set collection game for 2-4 players.

Devil of Timanfaya has hidden the stones from vineyards of La Geria. Players have the task of retrieving the stones and protecting their vineyards.

At the beginning, each player draws a vineyard board. Vineyards have different bonuses for specific suits of cards and attack or defence bonus.

Each turn player draws 2 cards from the deck or the face up tableau. Then they choose to play a set of cards, attack other player or pass. Additionally, they may also play any number of olivine cards (special powers).
A set of 2, 3, or 4 identical cards gives 2, 5, or 9 stones, respectively. Player may get additional stone for their suit. There are 4 suits: sun, water, volcano, and peasants. A set of 4 different cards gives 7 stones.
To attack, a player plays an attack card and add its bonus to a dice roll. The defending player rolls another dice and may choose to play a defence card afterwards. The totals of attack and defence are compared. The attacker takes number of stones equal to their advantage from opponent's vineyard.
If player doesn't play a set or attack, they pass.
Then they may discard unwanted cards and draw an equal number from the deck.
The players continue until one gathers 25 stones in their vineyard.

boardgame.name: Dtective Charlie part en vacances
boardgame.description: Four new adventures for Charlie.

boardgame.name: Sussed?: Orange
boardgame.description:
Family and friends quiz game of Selecting and Guessing

Each player is dealt a card. In turn players select and read a question aloud. Then the selector secretly chooses the answer closest to them personally. The other players secretly guess which answer (A B or C) the selector chose and win points if they are correct.

The game is played until all questions on all cards have been asked and answered.

boardgame.name: Forest of the Spider Queen
boardgame.description:
In this card-based expansion for Four against Darkness, instead of rolling on tables to generate places and encounters, the player(s) draw cards from a deck and apply the results to the adventure.

The deck contains:
17 tarot-size, full color cards
Instructions are included on the cards
2 unique monster cards
2 unique magic item cards

boardgame.name: Magonomia
boardgame.description:
Magonomia™ is the tabletop roleplaying game of Renaissance wizardry. The player characters are wizards whose magic is based on authentic sixteenth century folklore. Together, they explore mysteries in a world steeped in invisible spirits, enigmatic faeries, and secret societies.

Magic is the secret that cannot be told.

The Mysteries of Magic

Your wizard will wield one of the noble Sciences of magic: alchemy, astrology, theurgy, sorcery, or witchcraft. Their spells enable wondrous feats such as invisibility, flight, even forecasting the future. Innovative divination rules mean magic can always advance the story, but never spoils the mystery.

An Age of Wonder and Adventure

Magonomia is set in a fantasy version of sixteenth-century England that has the fantastic elements of Renaissance tales. You might meet the elemental spirits of Shakespeare's The Tempest, the faeries of A Midsummer Night’s Dream, the witches of MacBeth. Werewolves prowl the Yorkshire moors. Ghosts haunt the alleys of London. A host of invisible spirits swarm through the world and can be commanded by those who know their secret names. Enchanted England is a place of wonder and peril, a world ripe for adventure!

About the Core Rules

This hefty 379-page tome is the Magonomia core rulebook. It includes:


All the rules you need to play. Fate Core System rulebook is not required.
190 spells across five magical Sciences.
Over 60 pages of lore and detail about the Enchanted England setting.
A Bestiary of 16th-century spirits and creatures.
A GM's Sourcebook chapter full of plot inspiration, NPCs, and unique creatures.


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Flatline
boardgame.description:
Welcome to EMTcorp

Welcome to Flatline, a near-future dystopian roleplaying game about armed EMTs who execute intensive medical ops to protect the richest clients of Executive Medical Technologies. You play as a member of a Sammie team, an employee who works in Samaritan Division, the armed response division of EMTcorp.

You’ll work with your teammates to execute operations to recover, resuscitate, and revive your high-end clients on EMTcorps “Golden Hour” insurance plan. You’ll rush into firefights while conducting first aid, engage in vehicular chases while attempting to attach cyberware to dying clients, all while working for the largest private insurance company in the 23rd century.

Private insurance is a rich man’s game, and you can bet you’ll be rescuing the highest profile clients you can imagine.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Decktective: Den Tod kann man nicht betrgen
Decktective: la morte bara a carte
Decktective: You Can't Cheat Death
boardgame.description:
Decktective is a co-operative crime game. It can be played in a group or alone.

Las Vegas, 1950. The Domein Casino hosts a high-stakes secret game between three crime bosses and the mayor. When you arrive you are surprised: everyone at the table is dead! Who killed them and what was it about? Collect the facts such as documents, traces, audio recordings... Combine cleverly and find plausible solutions.

boardgame.name: Last Chronicle Infinity
boardgame.description:
A non-collectible card game depends on the background of Japanese collectible card game——Last Chronicle.

The games use picture from the old version Last Chronicle, but the mechanism is different from it. The mechanism is like Epic Card Game. Each player can use one 1-cost card and any number of 0-cost card each turn. The player who make his/her opponent's lifepoint to 0 will win the game.

A unique system of the game is the time-check system. Each turn the player will reveal a card from the deck to do a time-check. This player card use the card's time-check effect and use it as a special resource to play cards later.

boardgame.name: Deckscape: Im Wunderland
Deckscape: In Wonderland
Deckscape: nel Paese delle Meraviglie
boardgame.description:
Deckscape is a pocket sized escape room game. It can be played with a group of friends or alone.

In Wonderland, nothing is as it seems. It's a magical realm full of wondrous weirdness. There are thousands of strange things to admire. But woe to anyone who gets lost in Wonderland and angers the Queen of Hearts. Only a white rabbit, a cranky hatter and a grinning cat can help. Don't lose your head and you'll find your way back to your world.

listing.notes:
German 'Deckscape: Im Wunderland' edition.
Box shows little wear. Inside everything there in great condition. Game has been played once. Everything 'reset' - so ready to be played again.

boardgame.name: (Film Century)
boardgame.description:
The new works of Yang Zhixue, the designer of "The War of Song and Jin Dynasties" and "Decisive Victory", will take you to appreciate the development process of film art for a hundred years!

The steps of Odessa are screaming silently, the singing of Mumbai is surging, the beaches of Cannes are shining, the studios in Los Angeles are always noisy - the door of the factory has been opened, pick up the card in your hand, and write your own "Century of Movies" "Bar.

"One Hundred Years of Movies" is a game that supports 3-4 players. Each player will operate a film company established around 1896 and experience the development of the movie for a hundred years.
The game begins with the invention of the film by the Lumiere brothers in 1895 and ends with Hollywood's global dominance in the 1990s. During the course of the game, you will see countless dazzling names.

The real movie stills are used as illustrations in the game, and all the stills used have obtained the corresponding use authorization.

The basic system of this game is to build a card library, on which it draws on the classic board games "Dominion", "Brass", "Through the Ages" and "Several Acres of Snow" ( A Few Acres of Snow)", but overall it is still highly original.

The subsystems of the game include some interesting contents such as studio and theater system, industrial and aesthetic system, era system, commentary and market competition system.

The game weight is about 3.0, and the game duration is around 90 minutes. In order to make it easier for movie lovers without board game experience to start, we have also specially designed novice rules for novice players, and the complete video rules explanation of the game will also be uploaded to station B after entering the publishing process. You can scan the game package by scanning the The QR code to quickly learn the basic rules of the game through video.

Good luck with your studio shoot!

—description from the designer (translated)





——

3-41896
189590



(Dominion)(Brass)(Through the Ages)(A Few Acres of Snow)



3.090B



—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Alice's Race in Wonderland
boardgame.description:
This is a children's race game that casts players in the roles of characters from Lewis Carroll's popular novel "Alice's Adventures in Wonderland." Alice, the White Rabbit, the Mad Hatter, and/or the Queen of Hearts each follow their own single-color 80-space path to the finish, similar in nature to "Peter Rabbit's Race Game" (1917).

Although the game is built for 2 to 4 players, some editions accommodate up to 8 in teams of two (with two of each character's playing token provided). Alternatively, it is suggested that single players may use both identical tokens, always taking care to move the rear-most of the two.

boardgame.name: Merchants of the Crystal Sea
boardgame.description:
Merchants of the Crystal Sea is a two player, push your luck card game. Expeditions will gather new resources discovered on the island and return them back to the ship. Your goal is to score as many resource points as possible before the end of the game. But your opponent might have other ideas. Both players have to decide when to return back to the ship with the current resources or press your luck, trying to weather the events and retrieve a much bigger load.

Your ship has five expeditions to send out and collect resources. When it is time, collect the resources and return back to your ship and count the booty. Events may alter the success of your expedition. The longer you stay on the island the greater the chance you have to deal with these events (good or bad!).

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Lgion Paquet de cartes d'amlioration II
Star Wars: Legion Upgrade Card Pack II
boardgame.description:
Players can hire some of the most infamous mercenaries in the galaxy to join their armies with this card pack for Star Wars: Legion! The Card Upgrade Pack II contains updated unit cards for notorious bounty hunters Boba Fett, Bossk, Cad Bane, and even the A-A5 Speeder Truck that make them playable using the new mercenary rules introduced with the Shadow Collective Starter Set.

Additionally, players will also find copies of the three new command card for use with mercenary units from the Shadow Collective Starter Set. Finally, this pack also includes a selection of 60 upgrade cards designed to help them get the most out of their mercenaries, including the new cards introduced in the Shadow Collective Starter Set.

listing.notes: Title: Star Wars: Legion Upgrade Card Pack II Publisher: Atomic Mass Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Steel Rift
boardgame.description:
In the near future, in the wake of crippling solar flares, the remnants of humanity fight for resources, order, and sometimes glory.

Steel Rift is a fast paced skirmish game featuring highly configurable mechs called HE-Vs. Played on a 3’ x 3’ table, it’s easy to set up almost anywhere.

Customize your HE-V loadouts and hit the enemy hard in a fast-paced game of mechanized combat.

Written and developed by the writer of Last Days and Gamma Wolves, Ash Barker puts his passion for both apocalyptic and mech combat games on full display. With expansion to add more HE-V mechs, Campaign Modes, Faction-Building rules, and a variety of new Unit Types already in the works, you’ll have even more Steel Rift models, lore and rules to look forward to.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Doomlings: Dinolings
boardgame.description:
These prehistoric Doomlings are sure to be a hit amongst any fans of the Jurassic Era!

While this 18-card expansion pack is included in the Blackbox and Gold Bundles, Doomlings is an additive game. This means there's no limit to the number of Dinos you can add to your trait deck!

boardgame.name: Doomlings: Mythlings
boardgame.description:
These mythical monsters are sure to strike the fancy of any fans of fantasy! (Say that ten times fast!)

While this 19-card expansion pack is included in the Blackbox and Gold Bundles, Doomlings is an additive game. This means there's no limit to the number of Mythlings you can add to your trait deck!

boardgame.name: Petrify
boardgame.description:
Petrify is a finite territory game for two players: Blue and Orange. It is played on the spaces (squares) of an initially empty square grid (board). The recommended board sizes are between 6x6 and 10x10 squares.

Both players must have access to a sufficient number of disks of their own color and a sufficient number of neutral blocks.



Definitions

A group is a disk along with all other like-colored disks one could reach from it through a series of steps between orthogonally adjacent disks of its color.

Similarly, a patch is a square not occupied by a block along with all other such squares one could reach from it through a series of steps between orthogonally adjacent squares not occupied by blocks. Note a patch may contain any number of groups, as well as empty squares.

The size of a group or patch is the number of squares it spans.

A mound is a set of four blocks occupying a 2x2 area of the board.

A barricade is a set of three adjoining blocks in a straight diagonal line.

Mounds and barricades are illegal formations. For the purpose of spotting them, the edges of the board count as lines of blocks. In other words, the real board is considered to be the middle section of an imaginary board with sides two squares longer, and all edge squares on this larger board are considered to be occupied by blocks.



Play

Blue plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, if possible, make exactly one of these board plays:


Place a disk of your color on an empty square.



Move a disk of your color any number of squares in a straight orthogonal or diagonal line, without jumping over any blocks or enemy disks, to a square occupied by an enemy disk. Then, remove this enemy disk and place a block on the square from which you just moved your disk, without forming a mound or a barricade. Note a disk can jump over friendly disks.


If you have no board plays available on your turn, you must pass. Passing is otherwise not allowed.

The game ends when both players pass in succession. Then, for each patch on the board, the players jointly remove pairs of opposite-colored groups of the same size from it until there are no more such pairs to remove. The player with the biggest group left over in a patch owns the patch. Empty patches are owned by neither player.

The player with the higher score in the resulting position wins. Your score is the sum of the sizes of the patches that you own. If there is a tie, whoever made the last board play loses.



Pie rule

The pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means Orange will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with their opponent instead of making a regular move.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: In Rays of the Light
boardgame.description: In Rays of the Light is a first person post-apocalyptic adventure game by Sergey Noskov. The goal is to explore an area empty of people, and solve logic puzzles and study text messages, to reveal the story.

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Legion Essentials Kit
Star Wars: Lgion Kit d'Accessoires
boardgame.description: Help your players dive into the battles of Star Wars: Legion with this helpful kit! The Essentials Kit gathers together all the necessary cards, dice, tokens, and other tools players need to play the game in one convenient package, letting them get started quickly and easily. Additionally, this kit also collects the 12 battle cards for the 500-point Skirmish mode in a product for the first time, inviting new and veteran players alike to explore this alternate way to play.

listing.notes: Title: Star Wars: Legion Essentials Kit Publisher: Atomic Mass Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Legion Black Sun Enforcers Unit Expansion
Star Wars: Lgion Le Collectif de l'Ombre: Hommes de Main du Soleil Noir
boardgame.description:
Reinforcements arrive to help the notorious Black Sun syndicate spread its influence across the galaxy in this expansion for Star Wars: Legion! Operating out of its fortress on Mustafar, the Black Sun makes ample use of criminal elements willing to take on any task for the right price. This expansion invites players to hire an additional six Black Sun Enforcers that they can add to their Imperial, Separatist or Shadow Collective forces as a corps unit. Additionally, they will also find a Black Sun Vigo miniature that can lead this unit or act as a commander for the entire force. Finally, three command cards give these mercenaries their own playstyle while eight upgrade cards give players the chance to customize their units with additional weapons, gear, and more!

Contents:
7 Miniatures
2 Unit Cards
3 Command Cards
8 Upgrade Cards
10 Assorted Tokens
1 Insert Sheet

listing.notes: Title: Star Wars: Legion Black Sun Enforcers Unit Expansion Publisher: Atomic Mass Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: ImmunoWars: STD Booster Pack
boardgame.description:
The Naughty. Expand your ImmunoWars collection with a bunch of late-night bioweapons. Feeling itchy after that one-night stand? Infect your enemies with sexually transmittable diseases (STDs), such as Syphilis, Herpes Simplex, and Gonorrhea. Do you feel sexy, punk?

Features: 32 additional cards

Requires IMMUNOWARS to play.

-description from publisher's website
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: ImmunoWars: the Most Infectious Card Game

listing.notes: Title: ImmunoWars: STD Booster Pack Publisher: Boosterbox Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Calidar: Alfdan Ascendant
boardgame.description:
alidar’s Series 3 project features two warring realms of elves, cursed forests, druids, rangers, and living skyships.

The Queen’s Gift: As with previous releases, this campaign book’s opening chapter is a novelette running 18 pages (out of 132). It is the third episode of the Star Phoenix adventures, a skyship exploring the Great Caldera. The story is told in the style of the Voyage of the Princess Ark originally published in Dragon Magazine in the 1990s. The Queen’s Gift features a mysterious living skyship.

History: The Gazetteer’s main body goes on to unveil the history of the elves, covering events in their ancestral moon, Alorea, and in the Confederacy of Alfdaín on Calidar itself, a former colony of Alorea. The history tells of a bitter rivalry between the old elven empire and the younger, independent nation.

Geography: This chapter focuses on Alfdaín, describing the lay of the land, the people, the economy, and the region’s climates. More than 12 full-page maps are featured, including a monumental 9-page atlas based on Thorfinn Tait’s topographical artwork, and an overview of Undersea, the world of the sea elves, along with a map of the marine floor.

Riddle of the Woods: A sinister event, care of the old empire’s nefarious machinations, corrupted some of the forests covering Alfdaín. The evil plot lies behind this magical plague, threatening to overtake the whole of the confederacy. Each tainted region’s effects receive a detailed description.

The Law and the Sword: Alfdaín features an alliance of three sovereign realms. Who holds the power in each dominion, how they interact with each other, what armed forces they possess, how the traditional clans work, and what laws are in effect come through in these pages.

Behind the Curtains: Discover the guilds, brotherhoods, and secret societies in Alorea and Alfdaín. They are the tools behind Alorean schemes and Alfdaín’s survival. Whether player characters will tangle with them is less a question of when but rather how, and on whose behalf.

Elves of Calidar: The looks of five elven races, their motivations, styles, and game-related abilities receive meticulous treatments. The Sherandol are forest elves. These staunch defenders of freedom favor traditional clans. They dominate in much of Alfdaín. Their allies, the Elëan, favor mountains, relying on their wings to travel quickly. The Meruín dwell on the coasts and below the sea. Their troubles come from a mysterious menace in the marine depths against which they dispatched the paladins of the Rising Tide. The Tolarin are dark-skinned shadow dwellers, strong in magic. The Sòldor, as pale as their Tolarin allies are dark, bear a martial demeanor. They build great cities and, on Alorea, form an arrogant and merciless ruling class.

City of Mythuín: The capital city of Alfdaín is featured here, with district-by-district descriptions, as well as significant work on the sewers and other areas below ground. Time/location-sensitive random encounters, mini-adventures, and four pages of maps provide all details needed to grasp the city’s layout and its hidden dynamics.

Alorea: The old, off-world empire receives its own chapter. Its rulers command all on this moon. A magnificent two-page map shows the moon’s climate zones, biomes, topography, roads, major cities, and their inhabitants’ attitudes toward the Alorean dictatorship.

A Cast of Many: All the key personalities of Alfdaín and a few outer-world figures are described here, along with rules-agnostic game stats. This who’s-who catalog weaves a tangled web of clan intrigues, realm politics, and the schemes of secret societies.

Beasties in the Wilds: One does not have a worthy campaign setting without a few more fun monsters to amuse, annoy, or scare players with. On the menu: the abyssal dread and its ixthyan minions dead set on giving nightmares to the Knights of the Rising Tide, plus a smattering of colorful critters such as the forest elderkin, the lurker below, the seamera, and the sturmgänger.

All Hands on Deck: The final section gives an overview of the various skyships involved in this setting, along with their game stats. Five more pages of deck plans describe an elven flying vessel featured in the opening chapter, The Queen’s Gift, including profile and cutaway side views.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Rangers of Shadow Deep: Adventure Compendium I
boardgame.description:
This compendium binds together the first four supplements for Rangers of Shadow Deep.


Blood Moon



Temple of Madness



Ghost Stone



Incinerator


- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: Rangers of Shadow Deep: A Tabletop Adventure Game

boardgame.name: Thrones & Bones: Norrngard Campaign Setting
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Norrøngard

A land beset by undead horrors, marauding trolls, mercurial spirits, and monstrous beasts. In such a danger-fraught and challenging environment, heroes emerge to perform deeds worthy of the skalds, and those who don’t meet an early demise as a troll’s breakfast or a linnorm’s lunch carve out new domains or conquer existing ones.

Earn your honor exploring the cold heights of the Ymirian Mountain Range and the dark forest of the Raven’s Wood. Risk your life to snatch the knowledge of rune magic from the jaws of death. Contend with powerful vættir in the mysterious Wyrdwood, or brave the perilous caverns of Svartálfaheim.

The Thrones & Bones Campaign Setting draws upon world mythology and the novels of Lou Anders. Inside these pages you will find everything you need to play a campaign in Norrøngard, setting of the novel Frostborn, including:

• 3 new ancestries

• 8 new subclasses

• 2 new backgrounds

• 3 new feats

• 10 Norrønian towns

• New spells and magic items

• A brand new system of rune magic

• A system for tracking honor

• 37 new creatures and monsters

• 2 complete adventures

• And pages and pages of lore

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Calm Your Tits
boardgame.description:
(A "tit" is a kind of bird in England and most of the cards depict them. Some with balls of bird food. One card has cats on it. The clear intention is adult sexual innuendo.)

—user summary

The aim of this titillating pairs game for very silly adults is to win all the cards or be the last tit standing!
Players win cards for correctly shouting "Nice tits!" or "Tough tits!" when a matching pair shows, or for having the quickest hand action when the Fat Balls appear.
Watch out when the Pussy Posse are on patrol...things could easily go tits up!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Masticator Gate
boardgame.description:
A complete campaign for the world’s darkest roleplaying game.
Featuring three linked adventures, new monsters and hazards, eldritch relics, cults, demons, body horror, exsanguination, self-mutilation, execution, and a new character class.

Played to completion, this campaign has enough content for 5 to 7 sessions of play at 20+ total hours. The creatures, relics, character class, and other content can be reused infinitely and there is a guide for extending the campaign using other published material.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The Imperial Guide to Stormtrooper Tactics
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

For too long, Imperial tactics have relied on the use of overwhelming force to achieve victory. Unfortunately, the cowardly hit-and-run tactics employed by rebel terrorists in recent years have proven to be highly effective against our standard deployment tactics. Given enough time, an army of 1000 can be whittled away to nothing by the devious rebels. This is why we must adapt.

boardgame.name: LazerZ's Spacedock and Vehicle Depot
boardgame.description:
User summary:

An enumeration of several vehicles, with complete stat blocks.

boardgame.name: Adventures in Babysitting
boardgame.description:
An unofficial source book for "The Mandalorian" Seasons 1 and 2

From the introduction:

The Survival of the clan is above my own,
the strength of the clan is my own strength.
I pass on the way of the Mand’alor:
to heed his call ,to speak his tongue,
to bear his visage, always.

This is The Way.


-The Resol’nare Be Kyr’ad,
Six tenets of The Children of The Watch

boardgame.name: Memory Cores and Motivators
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

These additional options are part of species selection, and only starting xp may be spent this way. Multiple options may be selected from the Hardware and Programming categories. Standard droid species rules from Edge of the Empire or Age of Rebellion Core Rulebooks still apply.

boardgame.name: Precise Calculations
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A guide to planets.

User summary:

An alphabetical enumeration of various planets.

boardgame.name: Rebel Alliance Sourcebook Addendum
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The intention here is to simplify or clarify some aspects for military-centric campaigns. It is meant as a quick reference chart to add some background flavor if you are running or playing in a traditional military themed campaign. Perhaps your players are enlisted warriors and would like to see rank insignia; that sort of thing.

boardgame.name: X-Wing and RPG Compatibility Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is a fan-made how-to guide for converting your FFG Star Wars RPG character to an X-Wing pilot. It also includes guidance for GMs who want to run RPG starship encounters using Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition).

boardgame.name: Vaults of Torment
boardgame.description:
The Vaults of Torment is a modular dungeon for Mörk Borg. Explore a demon-infested hell-hole below the city of Schleswig. Summon creatures of dread to kill foolish adventurers and zombified prisoners. New monsters, items, Powers, and more.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Rules of Podracing
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The rules of podracing are an extension of the rules for a series of Piloting (Planetary) checks, each check made against a difficulty set by the current stretch of the course.

boardgame.name: Supply Run
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Star Wars galaxy is a vast and wondrous place. Filled with a myriad of species, millions of spectacular worlds, countless interstellar hazards and much, much more.

boardgame.name: The Big Book of Bounties
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Boba Fett. Bossk. IG-88. Cad Bane.
Bounty Hunters.
The very mention of a hunter on your trail is enough to make your blood run cold. They are the galaxy's most infamous trackers and will hunt another being halfway across the galaxy if the credits are right.

boardgame.name: The Old Republic
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the thousands of years before the rise of the Empire, the OLD REPUBLIC withstood assaults from mighty foes. It was an era of great light and great dark.

Through the eons, the stories of heroes and villains alike survive as lessons and warnings to all. The JEDI ORDER held as a bulwark of good against the evil forces of the SITH EMPIRE and the vicious MANDALORIANS for generations.

Between these great powers, the galaxy struggled to survive, seeking a living out amongst the stars...

boardgame.name: The Old Republic
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

People of the Galaxy presents a variety of new character options for players. Inside you’ll find 5 species that were prominent during the time of the Cold War and Galactic War, the secluded Dashade, the elegant Echani, the naturally Force-sensitive Miraluka, the combative Rattataki and the devious Sith.

boardgame.name: The Nubian Design Collective's Whole Vehicle Crafting Handbook
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

To put it bluntly, although the official starship crafting rules that appeared in Fully Operational is by and large a good framework/architecture, the details of its implementation leave a bit to be desired.

boardgame.name: Zargoth's Tome of Familiars
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Zargoth's Tome of Familiars is a compendium of over 100 strange and wondrous new creatures for 5e — unique familiars, pets, and companions for your new or existing characters.

The creatures are presented like those you would find in a monster manual complete with artwork, stat blocks, and lore, courtesy of the infamous demi-lich, Zargoth.

Each section is tied to all new Feats that grants access to a specific type of companion, such as clockwork creatures, undead servants, or baby monsters.

The Tome also includes the Kickstarter stretch goals such as a new Race that begins with an animal companion and 25+ Magic Items!

boardgame.name: A Family of Blades
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A Family of Blades is a tabletop roleplaying game about a team of criminals who became a family, broke up, and have now been thrust back together for one last job.
...
Put simply, you’re a criminal.

Perhaps you specialise in throwing down, hacking computer systems, cracking safes, or conning marks. Either way, you’re one of the best—or at least, you were one of the best, until your crew broke up and you retired.

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Legion Gar Saxon Commander Expansion
Star Wars: Lgion Le Collectif de l'Ombre: Gar Saxon
boardgame.description:
The ruthless Mandalorian warrior Gar Saxon blasts his way into Star Wars: Legion as a commander in Maul’s Shadow Collective! Filled with a desire for power and dominance, Saxon gives players even more options for their Shadow Collective forces with his elite Mandalorian training. What’s more, three command cards represent the brute strength and underhanded tactics he’s willing to use to ensure victory. Finally, seven upgrade cards give players the chance to equip Saxon with an array of deadly weaponry, including his iconic Galar-90 rifle, jetpack rockets, and a ZX flame projector.

Contents:
1 Miniature
1 Unit Card
3 Command Cards
7 Upgrade Cards
13 Assorted Tokens
1 Insert Sheet

listing.notes: Title: Star Wars: Legion Gar Saxon Commander Expansion Publisher: Atomic Mass Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Technical Readout: Irregulars
boardgame.description:
“The lions are those who managed to take the grid down, while the jackals are feeding on the resulting confusion.”

Fall of 3134. After decades of peace and prosperity, interstellar communications broke down two years ago and conflict is sweeping through the Republic of the Sphere. As ancient hatreds and rivalries rear their ugly heads, people who have only known war through history books are suddenly thrust into the dark maelstrom of combat. Splinter factions have arisen, aligning themselves with fealties long thought forgotten, and stalking each other on Republic worlds like jackals. Often lacking military-grade equipment, these groups and defending militias deploy SecurityMechs, Support Vehicles, or even modified civilian machinery in their desperate struggle to prevail.

Technical Readout: Irregulars unveils the weapons deployed during the chaos after Gray Monday when paramilitaries warred in the Republic’s outer Prefectures. Technical Readout: Irregulars debuts the production and custom machines used by the the splinter faction in 3132 and the following years. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 25 new IndustrialMech MODs, Security- and MilitiaMechs, support vehicles, and their variants ready for play.

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: LibrariaNPC's Starship Yard: Freighters
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

When purchasing a used ship, the player’s success on the negotiation (or similar) roll will determine the quality of the ship in question. Note that ANY used ship should have some sort of flaw or quirk in exchange for the bargain price.

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Legion Mandalorian Super Commandos Unit Expansion
boardgame.description:
Mandalorian Super Commandos bend the galaxy to Maul’s will in this expansion for Star Wars: Legion! Previously members of the notorious Death Watch, these elite Mandalorian warriors now follow Maul because he wields the Darksaber. With them, players have a powerful new special forces option for their Shadow Collective forces. In addition to six Mandalorian Super Commando miniatures and a unit card, players will also find three command cards specifically designed for use with mercenary units in this expansion as well as eight upgrade cards that invite them to customize their units with heavy weapons, new gear, and more!

Contents:
7 Miniatures
1 Unit Card
3 Command Cards
8 Upgrade Cards
14 Assorted Tokens
1 Insert Sheet

listing.notes: Title: Star Wars: Legion Mandalorian Super Commandos Unit Expansion Publisher: Atomic Mass Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: LibrariaNPC's Starship Yard: Starfighters
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is [a] bare-bones collection of ships.

User summary:

An enumeration of starfighter ships, complete with statistics block, image, and description.

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Lgion Le Collectif de l'Ombre: Fantassins du Syndicat Pyke
Star Wars: Legion Pyke Syndicate Foot Soldiers Unit Expansion
boardgame.description: Players can hire additional soldiers to protect their interests throughout the galaxy with this pack for Star Wars: Legion! Adding a corps unit of six Pyke Syndicate Foot Soldiers that can join Rebel, Imperial, Republic, or Separatist armies or band together with their fellow mercenaries in the Shadow Collective, this expansion gives players even more versatile options for building their forces. Furthermore, they’ll also find a Pyke Syndicate Capo who can lead a single unit or an entire mercenary army as a commander along with three command cards, opening up even more strategic choices. Finally, eight upgrade cards give players the freedom to kit out their units with heavy weapons, additional gear, and more!

listing.notes: Title: Star Wars: Legion Pyke Syndicate Foot Soldiers Unit Expansion Publisher: Atomic Mass Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Tabletop Gaming (Issue 66 - May 2022)
boardgame.description:
Tabletop Gaming
May 2022

boardgame.name: Hotline Dice Game
boardgame.description: 1 to 6 players take on the roll of Hotline operators. Every round more calls come in so everyone has to roll the dice to try and complete the hotline calls before they get built up and to try and get the right response to right calls.

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Lgion Le Collectif de l'Ombre, Bote de Faction
Star Wars: Legion Shadow Collective Starter Set
boardgame.description:
The galaxy’s seedy underbelly comes to Star Wars: Legion with the Shadow Collective Starter Set! This set introduces mercenaries to the game, inviting players to hire units from the notorious Black Sun and Pyke syndicates to join other faction’s armies. Alternatively, Maul himself can unite these disparate criminals under the banner of the Shadow Collective and lead them as a standalone force. Alongside his Mandalorian Super Commandos, they form a threat that could bring the galaxy to its knees.

Whichever path they choose, this set gives players plenty of new options for building their armies with 22 miniatures, including Maul, a unit of Shadow Collective Mandalorian Super Commandos, a unit of Black Sun Enforcers, and a unit of Pyke Syndicate Foot Soldiers. Additionally, players can further customize these forces with 30 upgrade cards that unlock heavy weapons, characters like Rook Kast, and more. Finally, this set also includes three command cards for use with the new mercenaries, three new command cards for Maul, and reprints of Maul’s three Separatist Alliance command cards.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Title: Star Wars: Legion Shadow Collective Starter Set Publisher: Atomic Mass Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) Chasseur de Ttes Z-95 Clone
Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) Clone Z-95 Headhunter Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
Support your Grand Army of the Republic forces with the Clone Z-95 Headhunter Expansion Pack for Star Wars: X-Wing! The Clone Z-95 starfighter is a light-weight, multi-role variant on the widely produced Z-95 Headhunter. The versatility and maneuverability of this starfighter make it a perfect support fighter able to fulfill a variety of roles.

This expansion contains everything you need to add two Clone Z-95 Headhunters to your Republic squadrons, including two beautifully painted miniatures in the classic Republic scheme, two maneuver dials, and tokens. Additionally, twelve ship cards let you choose the pilots who fly these starfighters into battle and eighteen upgrade cards invite you to customize your ship to fit your strategy.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

boardgame.name: Rough Riders!
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
Have you ever wanted to hop on your horse, pull out your guns and go on a wild charge up a hill while cannons go off around you? Sure you have! And now you can, in Rough Riders!

Rough Riders! is a one page RPG about hard-fighting men and women who are driven equally by their lust for battle and their complete insanity. Will your team achieve your objective, or will the stress of combat compel you to do something sufficiently ridiculous?

boardgame.name: Maximum Mutagenesis
boardgame.description:
May the ever present holy glow warm your marrow as you travel down the irradiated paths of Umerica!

Within these twisted pages you will find:


Getting the Glow - Looking to get mutated? Here is a list of what you need and where you might find it.
Lesser Mutations - A new form of simple mutations to inflict upon hapless wastelanders!
Three new character classes - Nuka’s Favored, Glow Shepherds, and Tainted Drifter.
The Mutation Alphabet - 26 illuminated tables of new mutagenic mischief.
Grokk’s Blessed Bestiary - Over two dozen “ordinary” creatures subjected to the mutagenic effects of the Mutation Alphabet, creating a slew of new horrors for wasteland adventurers to encounter.


- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: La Caza de la Calabaza: Edicin Integral
boardgame.description:
"The mad scientist Dr. Tomatenstein has been kidnapping and experimenting with lots of obakameshi (living foods) till he turned them into various new kind of pumpkins! But in the process some evolving into monsters too!!
This is an adventure game where a group of obakameshi enters Tomatenstein plantation to compile the new experimental pumpkins and expose to the world the evil plans from the Doctor!"

In this upgraded version of La Caza de la Calabaza the players must select between 12 main characters, and after choosen who will play first, this one turns the first card from the play deck.
If the card is an experimental pumpkin or an item, the player can put on his/her side of the table (maximum 2 cards from same kind in the player zone), but there can appears obakameshi monsters, some events cards, and of course the crazy Dr. Tomatenstein!
The goal of the game is to complete a pumpkin set collection. The first one to complete, wins the game.

—description from the publisher (English)

"El Dr. Tomatenstein es un científico loco que ha estado secuestrando y experimentando con muchos obakameshi (alimentos con coinsciencia) hasta convertir a varios en calabazas. ¡¡Pero en el proceso también convirtió a varios en monstruos!!
¡Este juego es la aventura de un grupo de obakameshi que se adentra en la plantación de Tomatenstein para conseguir las calabazas experimentales para así exponer al mundo los planes del Doctor!"

En esta versión actualizada de La Caza de la Calabaza los participantes deberán elegir entre 12 personajes, y tras elegir al jugador inicial este volteará la primera carta del mazo de juego.
Si la carta es una calabaza experimental o un objeto del juego, se lo quedará automáticamente (se puede tener un máximo de 2 cartas iguales de cada tipo en la zona del jugador), pero también aparecerán monstruos obakameshi, algunas cartas de evento, ¡y por supuesto el maquiavélico Dr. Tomatenstein!
La meta del juego será completar un set de calabazas experimentales. El primero en conseguirlas ganará la partida.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

boardgame.name: Light of Winter
boardgame.description:
Overview

Driven mad by the darkness of winter, the Prioress of the Red Abbey begins her work. After months of research and work in her lab, she found a way to summon beings of light to push back the darkness, if she could control their destructive natures. The characters find themselves investigating odd deaths, chasing weird weather phenomena and trying to help locals harmed by these creatures of light.

What Is This Document?

Light of Winter is an adventure kit. Within, you will find a set of antagonists and situations along with suggested encounters and locations. This book doesn’t string this information together in a traditional linear adventure arc, instead, it presents options for gamemasters to build the adventure to their preference and party. The most explicit portion of the adventure is the final dungeon, though it is still modifiable to meet a game’s needs.

Synopsis

The full adventure will change depending on the gamemaster’s choices, but the concept for the adventure follows. The Prioress, haunted by past trauma, summons light elementals from another realm. She hopes to fight against the darkness encroaching with their light. These elementals get loose several times, causing issues within the abbey and the nearby castle and their grounds. The characters investigate the odd occurrences around the abbey and castle, which leads them to the Prioress’s lair hidden in ruins of the old abbey. Their work must be fast, since the Prioress intends to summon a massive light elemental on the night of the winter solstice.

boardgame.name: Fantasy City Sites and Scenes III
boardgame.description:
This companion to Fantasy City Sites and Scenes and Fantasy City Sites and Scenes II presents new city locations and encounters that can be dropped into almost any fantasy campaign.


City sites. Each of the sixteen locations detailed in the book is presented on a two-page spread (for a total of 32 pages worth of locations) and includes a few assorted details the gamemaster can use to add flavor to the site, as well as assorted other bits of info that vary from location to location to give the site a little personality. Hooks that may lead to adventure are sprinkled throughout this section of the book.



City scenes. In addition to the city sites, the book also includes twelve pages of encounter ideas and two pages of random rumors.


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Fairy Trails
boardgame.description:
With this book, you'll be able to quickly craft and play a bajillion fun sessions where you and your group go on fun little missions playing quirky little fairies. But enough of this fanfare, let's get a list that tells you what's in the book!

This is a fast-paced game. Character progression is quick and each session is very well contained. This game is perfectly suitable for children of any age provided they can read, write, and won't try to eat the dice.


Powered By the Apocolypse World Engine: Fairy Trails uses the PBTA World Engine when it comes to dice and rolling and the whole general system.
13 Types of Fairies: In the book, the types of Fairies are called Kith. Most of them are based on old-timey fairies but there are one or two newish types in there (you can see most of them all if you click on the Preview).
13 Playbooks: In the book, the Playbooks are called Courts. You know, like Fairy Courts. These don't work exactly like most PBTA Playbooks, there are a few tweaks in them (you can see most of them all if you click on the Preview).
Extremely Cooperative Story Creating System: Fairy Trails was crafted with the idea that the whole group would engage in telling a story together. The GM (we call the GM the Driver in this game) is given story elements by each player (we call players Fairies in this game) at the beginning of a session that they have to try to incorporate into the story. There's lots of other stuff too, but the whole system does its best to make sure everyone is involved in the story-telling process.
Sized-Based Combat Mechanics: When Fairies Ruckus size is what counts the most, and that's what the system reflects. Combats are usually fast, non-lethal and very fun/silly.
Moves and Magic!: Fairies get Moves (Geasa) associated with their Court. Each Court also has a less specific magical ability. The Moves (Geasa) are pretty straightforward about what they do but the magical abilities are very open for players to play with.
4 Maps with lots of places!: There are four maps in the book, each with various places Fairies can go, each map has 16 adventure hooks with it. That gives you a total of 50+ adventure hooks!
Unlocking Stuff: As your Fairies progress so does the place you live. By playing the game, you can gradually unlock new Playbooks (Courts) and other bonuses for your current character and all characters that come after them!
Rivals: A list of Rivals Fairies are likely to run into and some ideas on how to play them and how they would fight. You'll also get a huge list of Rival abilities so you can customize encounters to you're liking!
Puck's Lottery: A unique take in rerolling that pushes your luck and can have some amazingly magically disastrous consequences.


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Chain Mail: Box
boardgame.description:
Medium Stout Box (Full Box Printed)

This game was released throughout 2019 in a starter kit and 12 monthly episodes. A box for the whole game has been released through The Game Crafter.

boardgame.name: Personal Space: Box
boardgame.description:
Medium Stout Box (Full Box Printed)

This game was released throughout 2020 in a starter kit and 12 monthly episodes. A box for the whole game has been released through The Game Crafter.

boardgame.name: Emergence Event: Captain Xeron and Xoron
boardgame.description:
Xeron the Planet Smasher and Xoron the Galaxy Conqueror

These two each bring 1 special ability to their ship:

Xeron grants +1 to any stat for control markers they have in their current Galaxy tile.
Xoron grants +1 to all stats if they completely control each Location in a Galaxy tile.


These two abilities stack.

However, at the start of the game they only have a two in each crew stat. This is by far the weakest start of any captain, but they have the unique ability to shift their stat bonuses to whatever stat they need for the current situation. As the game progresses and they control and conquer more of the galaxy, their power grows and if left unchecked can quickly eclipse everyone else.

boardgame.name: Emergence Event: Captain Laris Latee
boardgame.description:
Laris Latee is exceptionally good at uncovering the secrets of the galaxy. Ka-neetian scientists have been cataloging Discoveries for quite some time from their planet surface and recognize their true nature.

In game terms this is reflected by her ability to draw 2 Discovery tiles and choose which one to place for each Discovery revealed by exploring a new galaxy tile. Discoveries also have their required target numbers reduced by 1 for her with the ship's Class 3 Astrolab. In addition to these significant bonuses to Discoveries, many of her Captain Powers and her Open Space card revolve around manipulating Discoveries, either for her, or her opponents.

boardgame.name: Ruins of the Lost Realm
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Sourcebook for The One Ring 2nd edition.

boardgame.name: Space Pirates
boardgame.description:
"Infinite space awaits you! Unknown planets are calling to you with treasures and adventures. Now you can find out what the life of a real space pirate is like, searching for hidden treasures and even fighting battles to get more loot. It's worth taking the risk for the fantastic treasures, because their magic power can come in handy on your journey. But watch out, use them wisely!"

—description from the publisher

In Space Pirates the players are pirating astronauts who each turn roll a special die to determine their next destination. Reaching a yet unexplored planet is rewarded by a special treasure.
Each treasure may have a hidden special bonus action, which help the players navigate to harder-to-reach planets, evade asteroid fields, or even give an advantage in case of a fight when a meeting another pirate.
The game ends when all treasures are found, the player with the most treasure being the winner.

boardgame.name: Knight of the Sun
boardgame.description:
Will your players work to save the village of Dons Hollow from the evil plotting of a Necromancer? Or will they pose as heroes while secretly working to beat the Necromancer at his own game, setting in motion the eventual destruction of your entire campaign world?

The idyllic village of Dons Hollow has had a few bad weeks. First, the thorn bushes around the old battlefield hill north of town started growing out of control. Then came the rumors of strange folk seen wandering late at night through the hills around the village. It wasn’t long before people started disappearing. Then an entire family of farmers was found murdered. Finally, only three days ago, the village priest was found slain in his chapel. All of that would have been terrible enough, but when the village wakes one morning to find that it has become surrounded by giant walls of thorns and cut off from the rest of the world, panic takes hold.

“Knight of the Sun” is a fantasy roleplaying game adventure intended for three to six characters of 2nd to 4th level. Woven together from an OSR sensibility and difficulty level, this is the first in a series of adventure modules in which the PCs are either working as heroes to try and save the world from the Cult of Orcus or working as villains trying to outdo their rival cultists and spark off an undead apocalypse. This first chapter of the tale should take between two and five game sessions to complete (depending on play style and session length).

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Five Kilometers from Leipzig
boardgame.description:
Five Kilometers From Leipzig is a set of solo miniatures rules for black powder skirmish actions.

Take a band of 6 trusted companions and slug it out with enemy military forces, guerrillas or native warbands. Suitable for the era from roughly 1700 to 1870, the rules allow you to play a campaign easily and quickly.

Your characters will learn new skills, provided they survive the battle.

The rules use a simple and straight forward combat system, combined with the solo oriented turn sequence you know from Five Parsecs From Home and Five Leagues From the Borderlands.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Constant Downpour
boardgame.description:
Constant Downpour is a psychological sci-fi thriller based on Ray Bradbury’s short story, “The Long Rain”.

In Constant Downpour, players are Space Military soldiers who have just been dispatched to Venus in response to a distress call. SD-021, a sun dome located deep in the Venusian jungle, is under attack and requesting immediate backup.

Most soldiers deployed there become insane from the constant downpour, lack of sleep, and hallucinations caused by the atmosphere. Others die at the hands of Venusian soldiers, fall victim to lethal traps, or the horrors of the planet itself.

Constant Downpour is a 48 page system-neutral campaign setting that will fit easily into your favorite sci-fi RPG such as: Mothership RPG, Stars Without Number, or Starfinder.

It includes:


6 Adventure Phases full of ambient description tables
12 Maps
10 Retro sci-fi weapons (3 guns, 3 grenades, 4 stim packs)
30+ encounters, monsters, and traps
Supplemental rules for river rafting, using venom and poison, and utilizing illusions.
PDF supplements for easy GM note-taking for every map and encounter, 8 character questionnaires, + 3 print-out artifacts that can be handed to players as they are discovered.


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: LexOccultum - Gioco di Ruolo
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Italian boxed set including:
LexOccultum: Alter Ego
LexOccultum: Lex Libris
LexOccultum: Atlas Mundi
boardgame.rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (4th Edition)

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Rebels vs. Galactic Empire
boardgame.description:
"Choose your side of the Force and join the fight! Become the young Rebel Ezra, or the ruthless hand of the empire - The Inquisitor. Make use of your allies, defend or conquer. In this strategic card game it is you who will decide the fate of the galaxy. May the Force be with you!"

Star Wars: Rebels vs. Galactic Empire is a fast-paced card game for two players. The Rebel team must persevere against imperial superiority, while the goal of the Empire is to rush down and destroy the Rebels as soon as possible.

On one side of this galactic battleground are the Spectres, the heroes from the Star Wars Rebels television series. Opposing the heroic endeavors of the Ghost Crew is the massive power of the Empire, led by the Grand Inquisitor.

The empire wins if they successfully break into the Rebel base, while the Rebels win if they can keep the base and the imperial player run out of cards.

boardgame.name: Wayfarers of the South Tigris: Kickstarter Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
A set of 9 promo cards first offered during the 2022 Wayfarers Kickstarter campaign.

Wanderer: May spend 1 provision as 2 Silver.
Protector: May spend 1 provision or 1 Silver to retrieve a Worker and refresh a Die.
Comet: Worth 1 VP. Comes with a free Pink Upgrade.
Inspiration Card A: Requires 8 Land Cards (the starting City does count)
Inspiration Card A: Requires 8 Water Cards (the starting Harbour does count)
City/Library: Spend 2 Provisions to gain a Land Card and Journal.
Vista: Gain 1 Provision each time you gain an Upgrade of any type.
Harbour: Spend 4 Silver to draw 3 Space Cards. Keep 1 and place the other 2 at the bottom of the Space Card Draw Pile.
Open Water: Gain the top card from the Land Card Draw Pile.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Puns of Anarchy: Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
Ready to take your punning to the next level? This Puns of Anarchy Expansion Pack is the perfect addition to the base game, adding new ridiculous categories and loads of fresh Punnable cards. Make puns on nursery rhymes, cereal brands, and more!

This pack fits seamlessly with the original Puns of Anarchy game, and will add hours of wildly creative, laugh-out-loud punning.

boardgame.name: Dinoverse
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Dinoverse, a prehistoric world where dinosaurs roam. It is here that you will learn how to survive with your pack against the ever-changing landscape. Will you be able to adapt fast enough and manipulate the herd to your advantage, or will the transformations leave your pack broken? Use the Carnivores to cull the Herd and benefit from the rising body count. Expand the Herd with Herbivores and defend yourselves against the bloodthirsty Carnivores with all the tools available to yourself. The fate of the Herd is in your hands, will you lead them to abundance? Or devastation?

Dinoverse is a 2 to 5 player game where each player is assigned a Pack, consisting of 2 Dinosaurs, that journey alongside the Herd. The Herd is a central pool of dinosaurs that will interact with each other. Use each Dinosaur's unique ability to manipulate the Herd to your advantage. Carnivores eat other Dinos and score from the rising body count while Herbivores grow the Herd, and earn points by defending it against the Carnivore's onslaught. Manipulate game end events to your advantage base on the type of Dinosaurs in your pack. The player with most points, wins!

boardgame.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 558 - May 2022)
boardgame.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 558
May 2022
Ignorable Theme: Does anyone have Mad Magicians or Mad Clerics? Mad Other Types? Are they attempting to conquer the World(s)? If not, what are their goals?
boardgame.rpg: Good Society: A Jane Austen Role-Playing Game

boardgame.name: Maul Peak: Ancient Relics Mini-Expansion
boardgame.description:
Little is known of the lost ancients who created the guardians. With Skulk Hollow ravaged and Maul Peak now under assault, smallfolk scouts and scribes gather ancient relics, the remnants of that forgotten age, as they seek an edge in battle against the titanic monsters.

The Ancient Relics Mini-XP creates points of interest for additional gameplay!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Gridiron All-Stars
boardgame.description:
Gridiron All-Stars is a hard-hitting game of American Football set in a post-apocalyptic America. Gridiron All-Stars does away with the complexities and randomness that have become a staple of sports games; instead relying upon abstracted movements and euro-mechanics to deliver an authentic and quick-playing sports experience that takes mere minutes to learn yet many games to master.

Gridiron All-Stars relies upon action programming and resource management to create a deep tactical experience that captures the feel of the sport without getting bogged down in its nuance. Before each drive, choose a Play to determine what Actions your team will take on that Drive (action programming). Once the ball is snapped, you can use a limited pool of Action Cards to supplement or upgrade those actions to try to score a touchdown or tackle the opposing team’s ballcarrier.

Start playing the Base Game in 10 minutes. Captain a seven player Gridiron team in the local leagues to develop your favorite Plays, learn to manage player positioning, and how to maximize the impact of your Action Cards. When you’re ready for the primetime, unlock the asymmetric aspects of the game by taking control of one of one of the pre-made teams or create one of your own. Add Star Players and specialized Team Cards to unlock new levels of strategic and tactical depth.

Most importantly, Gridiron All-Stars plays fast. There are no dice. There are no charts. There is no waiting for your opponent to decide whether to block your action. Play moves quickly back-and-forth emulating as much as possible the speed with which the actual sport is played. Play as fast as you want – think speed chess – with a full game playable in 30-45 minutes.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dice Town: JAB Promos
boardgame.description:
A set of 3 cards designed by Ludovic Maublanc and drawn by Pierô Lalune, the set brings the organizers of the JAB gaming convention in the game of Dice Town. Originally planned as a goodie awarded for all 2020 attendees, it was later postponed due to the COVID-19 pandemic until the 2022 edition.

The JAB convention is a small open gaming convention in the province of Quebec.


Convert all your Jacks into Queens
Each player must give you a card then return a cart to each player
Each player must give you 1 nugget, 2$, or card

boardgame.name: Risk & Reward
boardgame.description:
Place your bet. Roll the dice. Correctly guess your opponent's chances and reap the rewards. Otherwise, it's your loss. Can you balance Risk & Reward?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Welcome to Fablerise
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

After setting out for adventure, the heroes find themselves caught up in a violent storm. They awaken in a strange new realm, with the chance to explore, make new friends, and maybe a few enemies. But will it be enough for them to find their way home...

A Two-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 1.

CONTENT WARNING: Violence against animals
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Riot!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a storygame about hard journeys.

With this one, I am approaching at some serious stuff I bear. The tone doesn't have to be heavy, but it can become very dark, depending on the values you choose to start with and the individualism you put in it. You can lighten the tone by reading "when you stay" instead of "when you reach" in the resolution mechanic.

boardgame.name: Old School Blue Map #09
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This PDF contains Old School Blue Map #9. The PDF has multiple layers allowing the options for numbered/non-numbered areas, secret doors on/off, and grid/no grid and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.name: Old School Blue Map #10
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This PDF contains Old School Blue Map #10. The PDF has multiple layers allowing the options for numbered/non-numbered areas, secret doors on/off, and grid/no grid and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.name: Old School Blue Map #11
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This PDF contains Old School Blue Map #11. The PDF has multiple layers allowing the options for numbered/non-numbered areas, secret doors on/off, and grid/no grid and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.name: Old School Blue Map #12
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This PDF contains Old School Blue Map #12. The PDF has multiple layers allowing the options for numbered/non-numbered areas, secret doors on/off, and grid/no grid and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.name: Old School Blue Map #13
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This PDF contains Old School Blue Map #13. The PDF has multiple layers allowing the options for numbered/non-numbered areas, secret doors on/off, and grid/no grid and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.name: Old School Blue Map #14
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This PDF contains Old School Blue Map #14. The PDF has multiple layers allowing the options for numbered/non-numbered areas, secret doors on/off, and grid/no grid and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The March 4, 2022 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:
