The March 11, 2022 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The March 18, 2022 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The March 25, 2022 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The April 1, 2022 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The April 8, 2022 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The April 15, 2022 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The April 22, 2022 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.name: Ethereal Ritual Site
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A rocky island with an altar of bones waits in the middle of a blue river of spirits. Bound souls writhe in distress, while a pentagon teleport is still lush and green like the material plane.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt featuring a shamanic duel and foul play, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Orcish Swamp Ritual Site
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A strange series of islands with altars in a swamp. At its heart waits a bone shrine above a pit shaped like a toothy maw.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt featuring the resurrection of the spirit of a dragon and a prophecy, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Burning Maximum Security Prison
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Magma bubbles at the base of a steep and rocky cliff. A metal elevator leads up, to locked cells filled with picked-clean skeletons of past prisoners.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt your players can explore the question, if angels can call, can devils rise? You’ll also save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Deep Sea Cavern
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A natural cave system deep underwater, in the dark abyss of The Black Chasm. Corals glow eerily, while some light flickers down from the surface below. A giant clam waits at its heart.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt featuring sea elves recovering buried treasure from their deceased, estranged veteran father’s estate, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: The Tome of Veils
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Veils; akasha given shape. As varied in scope as they are in function, these ingenious pieces of magical construction can be wielded by veilweavers to aid them in and out of battle.

The Tome of Veils seeks to expand upon the arsenals of these veilweavers, adding brand new and unique methods for them to utilize their magic in the form of 41 new veils! This book contains new veil options for all veilweaving classes in the Akashic Magic system released up to this point, and includes new enhanced, brand, and fleshwarp veils.

boardgame.name: Mythic Magazine Compilation #2
boardgame.description:
This compilation collects the complete volumes 7-12 into a single book. Articles include:

Customizing A Solo Adventure Before You Begin: Suggestions and rules for making sure your solo adventure has the elements in it that you want.

Randomized Starship Generation: The next specialized Region for the randomized version of The Location Crafter, Starships and Spacecraft!

Resolving Character Vs. Player Knowledge: Tactics for resolving moments in your solo adventures when you know more than your Character does.

Generating Compelling Backstories: A return to Backstory generation from Mythic Variations, with a new and more fleshed out Backstory Focus Table.

Matching An RPG To Your Style Of Solo Play: What's the best RPG to play solo? It depends! This article explores finding an RPG that plays well with your style of soloing, and adjustments you can make to your games for that RPG to work better for you.

Generating NPC Behavior With Fate Questions: Another take on generating NPC behavior, this time using Fate Questions with a few new twists.

Starting, And Ending, Scenes: Different ways to look at how to start and end Scenes, each impacting your Adventure in different ways.

Control Your Adventure With Keyed Scenes: A new type of Scene that allows you to steer and control your Adventure in new ways.

Solo Play Strategy - Focusing In: In this new Solo Play Strategy series, we look at different ways to play your solo adventures. Focusing In combines Mythic with The Adventure Crafter to create adventures that focus on big picture events, focusing in on specific events when you wish to learn more detail.

Solo Adventure Modules: This article introduces a new idea, adventure modules designed for modern solo play. This is a hybrid model that bridges the traditional solo experience with traditional RPG module play. Included in this issue is a full adventure to show how it works, the horror themed The Secret Of Tockley Manor.

Getting The Most Out Of Sourcebooks: A guide to using content in sourcebooks in your solo adventures.

RPG Social Skills With Mythic's Behavior Check: Rules for combining social skills from just about any RPG system with Mythic's Behavior Check, whether you're using them from Mythic Variations II or the simplified version from Mythic Magazine #1.

SoloRPG Mythic Starter: A Mythic Starter from SoloRPG where you play a beleaguered robot on a troubled spaceship.

boardgame.name: 108 Radioactive Mutations & Powers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is exactly what it says on the tin: a list of 108 mutations and superpowers perfect for any game where radiation has a chance to do something cool and not just make you very sick.

boardgame.name: 108 Divine Titles & Godly Epithets
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is exactly what it says on the tin: a list of 108 titles and epithets that would be perfect for the gods and goddesses in your next campaign. These entries are taken from a variety of mythologies, including Egyptian, Norse, Roman, and Sumerian.

boardgame.name: 108 More Divine Titles & Godly Epithets
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is exactly what it says on the tin: a list of 108 titles and epithets that would be perfect for the gods and goddesses in your next campaign. These entries are taken from a variety of mythologies, including Egyptian, Norse, Roman, and Sumerian.

boardgame.name: 100 Fantasy Flavors of Gigglefish Gum Vol. 1: Originals
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

“Gamble Van Shotzalot Pinkyton Gigglefish was a wizard who used his arrest in the town of Mad Rose as an opportunity to better himself. Disgusted by the food, he offered the warden a wager - if he could make the prison food taste better at the same cost as their daily gruel, then he would act as the prison chef for the rest of his sentence. If he lost then he would be gagged for a year. And so, Gigglefish became a cook.” (“Famous Gnomes” by Galimus Penthorne, Volume 17).

Each piece of Gigglefish gum is enchanted with an appearance/flavor that mirrors another food precisely. The 100 original types of gum are all natural foods due to a limitation of the original spell. The Gigglefish merchant house now sells these original flavors of gum for 1 copper coin each. The flavor lasts for as long as the gum is chewed, or about 1d6+8 minutes. This magic food is intended for fantasy games (like D&D, Pathfinder, etc.).

boardgame.name: 100 Fantasy Flavors of Gigglefish Gum Vol. 2: Tavern Treats
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

“Gamble Gigglefish took his strange but wondrous chewing gum across the continent of Clymar. He travelled as far as Klovistok to sell it. And while it was successful, there were demands for more variety. Years later, all of his research paid off and he learned of a method to store multiple flavors within the gum. This allowed him to expand his business beyond the penny candy of children to the world of adults.” (“Famous Gnomes” by Galimus Penthorne, Volume 17).

Each piece of Gigglefish gum is enchanted with an appearance/flavor that mirrors another food precisely. The 100 types of tavern food are more sophisticated than the original flavors - you can taste multiple flavors, ambient heat, and even taste combinations. They sell for 1d4+2 copper coins each. The flavor lasts for as long as the gum is chewed, or about 1d6+8 minutes. This magic food is intended for fantasy games (like D&D, Pathfinder, etc.).

boardgame.name: Mother Hoarfrost
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

We at Rookery Publications have been mulling for months how to present a bestiary that works for as many different roleplaying games as possible. What you hold in your (digital) hands is our first answer to that question: a wintry horror for use with any setting, with stats designed to be easily adapted to any RPG system. So, no matter your game of choice, you can use the chilly joys of Mother Hoarfrost.

This supplement was originally created as a festive gift for patrons of Inside the Rookery, our live-streamed, weekly panel show. There we are joined by guests from across the industry as we draw back the curtain on what happens behind the scenes of the games we all know and love. We also invite our viewers to ask questions and make comments as we go, ensuring everyone is involved.

Now Mother Hoarfrost is available for everyone to try.

boardgame.name: 350 Items in a Cyber City Vending Machine Vol 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The futuristic vending machines of Cyber City have naturally filled the void that many small stores used to occupy. These new self-contained vending machines commonly dispense goods, and are armed with military grade weapon systems to protect the goods and the machine itself from gangs, cyberpsychos, and all the desperate common citizens. The vendors are filled with newly found products from neglected shipping containers, forgotten warehouses and abandoned factories.

This tool can be added to any dark future roleplaying game (like Cyberpunk 2020, Cyberpunk Red, Altered Carbon, Shadowrun, Carbon 2185, GURPS Cyberpunk, Android, Aeon Flux, Rifts, Interface Zero and more) where stores and shops are the exception, not the norm.

boardgame.name: Cooking for Monsters (Orcs & Goblins)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Whether you're hosting a block party and need to figure out what to serve the bugbears that moved next door, or just running an RPG campaign and looking for ways to flesh out your world, Cooking for Monsters will tell you what you want to know.

In Cooking for Monsters, you'll learn about the dietary needs (and tolerances) of orcs, goblins, and their cousins, fungal alcohol, worm jerky, and the weirdest kind of tea in the world.

Did you know that there's a kind of bee that makes savory honey from a combination of meat and nectar?

boardgame.name: Cooking for Monsters (Vampires)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Whether you're hosting a block party and need to figure out what to serve the bugbears that moved next door, or just running an RPG campaign and looking for ways to flesh out your world, Cooking for Monsters will tell you what you want to know.

In Cooking for Monsters, you'll find out what kind of flavors vampires enjoy, the culinary aspects of blood, and how to estimate the amount of blood in a given animal (very useful if you're want to know whether you need one catoblepas or two!). There are even specific dishes, like black pudding, and butchery dumplings, and...cow's blood candy bars? I didn't make that up. Those actually exist.

Did you know that blood is a suitable replacement for eggs in most recipes? Now you do!

boardgame.name: Cooking for Monsters (Hags & Zombies)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Whether you're hosting a block party and need to figure out what to serve the bugbears that moved next door, or just running an RPG campaign and looking for ways to flesh out your world, Cooking for Monsters will tell you what you want to know.

In Cooking for Monsters, you'll learn about the biology (and necrology) of these anthrophages, how human flesh does (and does not) taste like pork, and why zombies hate cheese and wine. There are even ways to prepare specific parts of the body, from brain fritters to blood-scrambled eggs to bone-trenchers full of marrow for dipping your bread.

Did you know that a mouthful of powdered teeth has a calorie value of 30-40 valories? Now you do!

boardgame.name: Destined - Superhero Roleplaying
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Destined - Superheroic Roleplaying

Who are you destined to be?

If you were given fantastic powers, who would you be? Would you try to save the world - or conquer it? Would you promote peace and justice, or foster fear and demand blind obedience? Would you strive to be the world’s greatest hero or its most infamous villain?

Destined is a game of super-powered role playing. You take on the roles of individuals with amazing abilities and try to find your place in a world inspired by comic books and other superheroic media. Using an extensive array of superpowers you create whatever hero you can imagine, and take to the mean streets to mete out justice using your trusty 1d100 and a well stocked utility belt.

Based on the acclaimed Mythras rules, Destined is an easy to learn and action-packed game system. Destined gives you all the rules you need to create the superhero stories you want to tell. From four colored tales of spandex and capes, to gritty stories of real world crime, Destined allows you to play as whatever superhero (or villain) you want to be.

Destined is a complete roleplaying game. All you need are some friends, dice, and your imagination...

boardgame.name: (Werewolf Which)
boardgame.description:
In (lit. Werewolf Which, phonetically Jin-roh Docchi), a kind of a One Night Werewolf game, each player picks one of the two role cards for their hidden role for the game, and place the other face down on the table. This makes each player knows a role that should NOT in the town, in addition to their role, making deduction and bluffing more interesting.

As in One Night Werewolf, during the two discussion phases in a game, Civilians (non-Werewolf players) try to deduce who the Werewolves are, and Werewolf players try to hide/bluff their identity. There are special actions done before/between the discussion phases depending on the role, ranging from Seer or Cop to see the cards, or even DJ to exchange a player's role card to their unused card.

Then one and the only voting in the game is held to decide whom to expel from the town. Civilians win when a Werewolf gets most of the votes, otherwise Werewolves win.

boardgame.name: Besaz Bendaz
Build & Blast
boardgame.description:
The obstacle of housing shortage has been plaguing the government for a long time. Finally, the government has made an important decision: handing over several plots of land to large investors and contractors to build high towers! After many challenges, 3 large plots of land have finally been selected in 3 different neighborhoods of the city to build 5 towers on each by the biggest investors of the city.

In Build & Blast, players are given the role of the investors, to build 5 towers in a neighborhood each round, and while doing so, secretly invest in some towers. To earn more points, players should try to raise the tower on which they have invested more and sabotage other towers. The game ends at the end of the third round with the construction of 5 towers in the third neighborhood, and the investor with the most points will win.

In Build & Blast, there are several tiles, each representing a floor of a tower. In each neighborhood, 5 towers with 5 different designs and colors will be built. Some tiles belong to one or two specific towers, and some tiles can be placed in the body of all towers. A few special tiles, without being inserted into the body of the towers, will make changes to the building plans.

boardgame.name: The Temple of the Kraken God
boardgame.description:
"To the east lies GRIFT. Further east still lies nothing but the Endless Sea.
That has been true for as long as people can remember. From the highest of GRIFT's awful towers, Kloderich, who wanted to end his sorry life, spotted a black isle on the horizon.
Royal telescopers pan their tools to measure and catalog. A discovery! Some crooked structure rises from the bluffs. What may it be, what secrets does it hold?
The rocky oddity, abomination, and dead-sure salvation lures."

The Temple of the Kraken God is a Mörk Bork adventure by Christian Eichhorn (christian.eichhorn.dmg@gmail.com; @squirrelgolem), with editing by John Parker.

Board a ship to explore a newly risen island. Become corrupted beyond your wildest dreams and bath in parasitic ecstasy. The Kraken welcomes you to the KULT.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Bone Heart Crusaders
boardgame.description:
A Glorious Hex-Crawl Crusade Into the Valley of the Unfortunate Undead.

Bone Heart Crusaders is a Mörk Bork adventure by Christian Eichhorn (christian.eichhorn.dmg@gmail.com; @squirrelgolem), with editing by John Parker.

Heeding the call of Adalbert the Warhawk, a host assembled. Thousands of starving soldiers took up sword, flail, cross, and shield. Fight for life, fight to the death.

"Today is a good day to make war.
With a last hurrah on cracked lips, we march into doom.
All, toward the Valley of the Unfortunate Undead!
On top of a hill of dying soldiers, together, we stand strong."

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Apocrypha
boardgame.description:
Monstrous classes, diseases, tables for birth and death, and new monsters for Mörk Borg.

Apocrypha is a Mörk Bork adventure by Christian Eichhorn (christian.eichhorn.dmg@gmail.com; @squirrelgolem), with editing by John Parker.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Galgenbeck: Sacrifice
boardgame.description:
Galgenbeck: Sacrifice is a Mörk Bork adventure by Christian Eichhorn (christian.eichhorn.dmg@gmail.com; @squirrelgolem), with editing by John Parker.

The sun vanished behind a black disk months or years ago—who could tell. Now, a comet plows across the sky, leaving behind a trail of bloody pieces. The Galgenbecker people are confused, incited, whipped into a frenzy. So many innocent dangle from the trees. The stank lures in the ravens and worse.

Half of Galgenbeck's population is gone. Most have fallen to Josilfa's scythe. The city seems eerily empty, but nobody notices the citizens' absence. Galgenbeck was always half empty. All is as it should be.

This is a multi-session adventure about ritualistic, human sacrifice. To stave off destruction and appease Nechrubel, who rides a comet across the sky, Josilfa beheads the unwanted. Since the sacrifices not only vanish from the world but also from the memories of those who are left behind, the characters may forget about their mission and themselves.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Against the Dark Conspiracy
boardgame.description:
Against the Dark Conspiracy is a supernatural thriller tabletop roleplaying game for 4-6 players. One of them takes the role of Control while the others each play an Operator.

The game is inspired by the mechanics of, among others, Cthulhu Dark (by Graham Walmsley) and settings such as Night's Black Agents (by Ken Hite).

Against the Dark Conspiracy is written to require zero preparation but includes advice to Control on how to prepare or adapt materials published for other games, if that’s an approach they prefer.

[from itch.io page]

boardgame.name: Into the Fey Wilderness
boardgame.description:
This 33-page book contains a 15-page fey-themed adventure, plus 18 new fey-themed critters ranging form CR 0-CR11! In these pages you'll find jackalopes, wampus cats, dreaming trees, and flower mice, plus fey beasts inspired by the folklore of Eastern Europe; and you'll venture into the Hedgegrove, the realm of Princess Dandelion, an immortal Archfey of the Summer Court.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Uprising: Titans of the First Age Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Titans of the First Age expansion opens up tons of new options for your armies, as well as bringing in new factions, rerolls, more baddies, and of course, more dice:

- 13 Mercenary Units
- 26 Nemesis Banes
- 2 New Factions
- 3 New Dice Types
- 1 New Mechanic

And more...

Contains all Unlocks from our Gamefound campaign.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Uprising: Curse of the Last Emperor

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry Kruleboyz
boardgame.description:
These kunnin’ greenskins have been rising up all across the Mortal Realms, and not even the harsh environments of the Eightpoints can keep them away. The Kruleboyz have come for no better reason than to invade, loot, and turn it into a stinking swamp they can then call home. Don’t make the mistake of underestimating them – they’re not afraid to fight dirty, and their envenomed weapons and sneaky tricks are enough to keep any opponent on their toes.

The Kruleboyz are always ready for a scrap, and they could hardly care less who they’re bashing up. If you love the idea of a sneaky, underhanded warband that can dish out horrendous punishment, the Kruleboyz just might be for you. Inside the box, you’ll find additional fighter cards for a variety of models in the Kruleboyz orruks range. This box includes the multi-part kits of Gutrippaz and Man-skewer Boltboyz, so there are plenty of ways to build up your warband to ensure a good variety.

This warband set contains:


10 Gutrippaz, armed with a mix of jagged blades, bludgeons, and shields
3 Man-skewer Boltboyz, armed with deadly crossbows and wicked blades
Kruleboyz wound divider and abilities cards, allowing you to use all sorts of sneaky tricks
14 fighter cards, including: 1x Killaboss on Great Gnashtoof, 1x Killaboss, 1x Murknob with Belcha-banna, 1x Swampcalla Shaman, 4x Gutrippa variants, 2x Man-skewer Boltboy variants, 2x Hobgrot variants, 1x Stab-grot, 1x Pot-grot
84 tokens, including: 24x activation tokens, 32x double-sided wound tokens, 2x initiative markers, 10x special tokens, 16x objective marker/treasure tokens


— Description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry Starter Set
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry Catacombs
Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry Red Harvest

boardgame.name: Crystal Collapse
boardgame.description: Crystal Collapse is a card-driven tactical combat game for 2-4 players with immersive background story. Inspired by the great tactical JRPGs, the game offers exciting battles where positioning and alignment are key to success.

boardgame.name: Day of the Skittering
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

Want a break from your main campaign? Day of the Skittering is a Free, level 8 One-Shot for 4–6 players taking place in a plagued city full of rotten monsters.

boardgame.name: Shadow and Steel
boardgame.description:
The Shadow and Steel Expansion adds 12 agents and 4 tyrants to the base game.
The agents have two categories: Shardhunter and Schemer. Each player controls one of each type during the game, selected at the draft. Every agent has a unique active and passive ability, for a wider range of possibilities.
Shardhunters move across the wilderness, gaining extra abilities based on the quests they complete.
Schemers help the player to dominate the Havens, they also have extra abilities.

Tyrants add unique opponents to solo play. Each has 3 levels to fine-tune the difficulty. By including them and the agents you can play through a gradually more challenging solo campaign of 12 missions. This campaign is further supported by event cards, which can even be used in multiplayer, breaking the basic rules, creating interesting situations, and increasing replayability.

boardgame.name: The Big Shuffle: The Red Light Expansion
boardgame.description:
Expansion of Gambling and Vice
Array of new cards that change up the game
Includes new characters, locations and situations
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Big Shuffle: A Film Noir Card Game

boardgame.name: The Big Shuffle: Above the Law Expansion
boardgame.description:
Expansion of law, order, and vigilantism
Array of new cards that change up the game
Includes new characters, locations and situations
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Big Shuffle: A Film Noir Card Game

boardgame.name: Heart Stone of the Wave Keep
boardgame.description:
An entry in the tenfootpole Wavestone Keep contest!

From the publishers blurb:

Terror grips the coast. Tavern boil over with rumors of mysterious reptilian reavers raiding fishing villager and sinking merchant vessels. But these are no ordinary pirates, they op0erate out of a floating tower that appears out of the night and moves against the tides. This impossible story is make even more improbable as it is said the tower is topped with a great ghostly eye that rains down fire upon its foes.

boardgame.name: Anawak Starter Set
boardgame.description:
Ce- Anahuac “The Known World” in Nahuatl.

Anawak is a Mesoamerican miniature skirmish tactical game where up to four players must foster the greatest army of the continent immersing into a highly mythical Mesoamerican world, The players will search and persuade warriors to join their cause, gather and shape obsidian for arrows and macuahuitls (swords), prove their shamans in battle so they can understand the cosmos, siege Cities, protect temples, Invoke creatures of old: Battle by battle the warriors will become jaguar or eagle warriors, and if they are lucky to survive they will become leaders. Owl-Man (Shamans) will become Astronomers and Invocators, and in the end, only the player that invokes The great spirit of Quetzalcoatl will win the Tournament….

Or bring total destruction to all, of course.

Anawak Starter Set has 3 “Tutorial” Tournaments of 5 battles each. The tournaments were meticulously designed to let you start playing without learning all the rules, you will learn as you play. As you advance, the battles grow in size and epicness! Every battle let the players experience different tactics and scenarios: Siege, area control, extermination, summon gods, exploding volcanoes, run-for-your-life-from-flooding-cities scenarios, and more.

And when you end the 15 battles you can start all over again, mix and match battles to create your own tournaments, or with the help of the “New scenario sheets” and the 80+ different tiles of the board you can create infinite battle scenarios.

Anawak Starter Set comes with 24 different miniatures and a total of 65.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Race to Bastogne: A Solitaire Wargame
boardgame.description:
The Race to Bastogne is a 'hex and counter' style game which puts you in charge of armoured units from the US Army in the Battle of the Bulge in 1944 World War II. You will be commanding small groups of Sherman tanks, Priest mobile artillery and Greyhound armoured cars in order to clear routes across the freezing countryside to Bastogne, where the US 101st Airbourne are surrounded by the enemy.
You will need to supply at least 3 but preferably 5 standard six-sided dice. Sample counters have been included at the end of the book which you can cut out or copy, and stick to card if you wish.
In full colour, rules and 12 replayable missions are included.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Hackagon
boardgame.description:
Hackagon is a cyber security game that can be played with 2-4 players. The game is about the challenge between the Blue Team and the Red Team.

The purpose of the game is to develop the best strategy to strengthen the security of the system or to deepen security gaps to create vulnerability in the system.

The factors for determining the winner of the game are created by individual or collective choices during the play and the right use of in-game elements.

The purpose of the Blue Team is to provide security of the current system. The Red Team aims at spreading in all cells of the system by doing the greatest harm to the system. The basic motivation of each team is the achievement of required basic information and their usage towards developing an effective strategy in accordance with the aim.

Besides, team members can behave as Purple Team during the play. Players who come to the relevant phase do interactive studies with each other to share data about cyber security vulnerabilities. The achievements in this part directly contribute to teams and players.

All players in the game can earn extra income by actively taking place at cryptocurrency market. Players who experience market’s volatility based on the analysis and news on the relevant cards try to predict the investment tools to advantage them.

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Shrapnel Magazine Issue 9
boardgame.description: More Shrapnel, featuring fiction from both new and established BattleTech authors, and new game material.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Hostel After Dark
boardgame.description: A NSFW edition of Hostile Hoarders where players battle each other with modified adult toys and collect carnal cards for points.

boardgame.name: Mystery Empire
boardgame.description:
A party game for people who want to conquer each other. Pick a secret identity and correctly guess the identities of other players to build your empire while using deception to remain unconquered yourself.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Empire Alone An ilClan Era Sourcebook
boardgame.description: Empire Alone is a sourcebook providing full details of the events around the Wolf Empire and Free Worlds League from 3151 to mid-3152. Included are a full historical summary of events in those regions of space, personality and unit profiles of key players—many appearing here for the first time, and game information to bring it all to your BattleTech tabletop.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Ortrick
boardgame.description:
Otrick contains rules for playing a trick-taking game with either 2 ("Violet") or 4 ("Scarlet") players; in the case of the latter, it is a 2v2 team game.

The game uses two decks of cards, one which represents the possible suits and one which represents the possible ranks. (There are additional cards for determining the trump suit, teams, and roles.)

In Scarlet, if one person on a team plays a suit, the other must play a rank. One of the teammates is assigned to be the "boss", and when their team wins tricks, this player will always then lead. (These roles rotate at the end of each round.)

In Violet, the remaining cards are dealt to a strawman player, and each player will play 2 cards to every trick, one from their own hand and one from the shared strawman.

For both rulesets, your goal is to win either 0 to 3 or 7 to 8 tricks. Some cards and suits may also be worth points. The person/team with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Hot Stove 1: The Mother of Battle
boardgame.description: This is ATS ALL NEW HOT STOVE 1, a set of 6 scenarios + AFV Cards set on a 24" × 52" map that begins a series of large, large hex actions. This is NOT the old Hot Stove 1. Ownership of standard German, Russian, American and British Personnel and AFVs, plus the ATS Rulebook 2014 and standard system small and large markers - is required to play.

boardgame.name: Fey With the Dragon Tattoo
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Journey to Samsara, the Feywild's Domain of Delight, a realm of Rewards, Reincarnation and Fortune.

Inspired by The Myths of the Lunar New Year and the Animals of the Eastern Zodiac.

A mystical underwater saga in the Domain of Delight, Samsara.

A sacred stone has been stolen from the Coral Kingdom of the archfey of Samsara, The Dragon Lord. Summoned to track down the thieves across the aquatic sea of the feywild. Beware, shadows hide deep in the deep abyss waiting for an opportunity to strike.

The Feywild: The Domain of Delight, Samsara.

An adventure for adventurers to reach the magical feywild. The Domain of Delight, Samsara is unique in that it is ruled by thirteen powerful Archfey that share this domain. These Archfey are known as the Zodiac XIII. Explore the Coral Kingdom, Wild Waters, and the village of Ryboslav's Retreat.

Adventurers will have opportunity to meet one of the archfeys of Samsara, The Dragon Lord.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: An Arcane Prisoner
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is our eighteenth installment of the one-page-dungeon series. The objective is to create self-contained adventures/dungeons with all things necessary to spawn fun adventures in a single page.

This adventure is about a quirky mage who lives in the forest about an hour away from the nearest settlement. Shadenis is trying to perfect a conjuration spell that will allow him to permanently summon/create gold and silver coins. Some goblins have been watching him create a few coins so they decided to attack his home and make him prisoner. Shadenis, the mage, managed to send an animal messenger to the nearest town major. The major now offers a considerable bounty for anyone willing to go check up on the hermit mage.

boardgame.name: Cursed Mausoleum
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is our nineteenth installment of the one-page-dungeon series. The objective is to create self-contained adventures/dungeons with all things necessary to spawn fun adventures in a single page.

A pair of disobedient teenagers went inside the sunned mausoleum because they wanted to see what old tales were really about. The locals avoid this place because it belongs to the last despot rulers of these lands, a few decades ago.

Two hunters went to the crypt to retrieve the young ones but they too didn't return. Perhaps a group of valiant soldiers and adventurers will accept a reward of gold pieces in exchange for exploring the tomb and retrieving the missing people. Still unknown is the fact that the tomb is cursed with the hatred and suffering of those buried within. These undead abominations are bound to the crypt but the recent visitors have stirred their peace. Rescuing the teenagers or the hunters is a low-probability quest. Time is essential, perhaps they can hurry and make a difference.

boardgame.name: Tomb of Heroes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is our 20th installment of the one-page dungeon series. The objective is to create self-contained adventures/dungeons with all things necessary to spawn fun adventures on a single page.

In this adventure, the location of an ancient tomb from a bygone era has been unearthed. Many mercenaries and sellswords have tried to plunder this burial site without success. There are rumors and legends about the kind of treasures hidden within. This is the perfect place to hide an ancient relic or piece of information that the characters need to advance the greater scheme of things. There are nasty undead, foul traps, and the sense of discovery of exploring a place that no one has seen in thousands of years!

boardgame.name: The Vermilion Vault
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is our 21st installment of the one-page dungeon series. The objective is to create self-contained adventures/dungeons with all things necessary to spawn fun adventures on a single page.

In this adventure, the location of an ancient vault has been revealed! It is rumored to hold a grandiose treasure that an ancient order of knights left. The Vermilion Knights protected the innocent from evil a long time ago. They were suddenly defeated and were declared war heroes. Their most valued treasure was supposedly interred in a vault. Many have tried to explore the shunned dungeon but the traps and guardians within have proven to be too much for would-be adventurers and petty robbers. Now, the characters have the chance to find a magical artifact and learn the truth of what happened to the Vermilion Knights.

boardgame.name: Prison of Souls
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is our 22nd installment of the one-page dungeon series. The objective is to create self-contained adventures/dungeons with all things necessary to spawn fun adventures on a single page.

Not all stories have a happy ending. It is the other way around more often than not, contrary to what fairy tales would have children to believe. The origins of the Prison of Souls can be traced down to these kinds of stories. It all occurred 300 years ago in Noria, the now called ghost-town. No one desires to live there after what happened. The small town of Noria had the misfortune of becoming Ragazar’s target, a powerful necromancer who craved becoming a lich. To achieve this, Ragazar required the souls of many mortals. He deemed Noria the perfect place to perform a befoul arcane ritual.

The heartless necromancer had the wit to inform the town of what he was about to do. Trusting his abilities, Ragazar doubted the poor people of Noria would come up with a solution or even less a contender. Nevertheless, they did. The town produced Sir Justin Lands, a folk hero and paladin who promised to come out victorious and protect the territories and people of Noria...

boardgame.name: Cavern of the Crystal Dwarves
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is our 23rd installment of the one-page dungeon series. The objective is to create self-contained adventures/dungeons with all things necessary to spawn fun adventures on a single page.

Dwarves are prone to their greed and curiosity. Most are just like cats. Once they get a glimpse of precious stones, the smell of a rare ore vein, or the distinguishable glint of gold and mithral, they become unable to let go and commit to extracting all they can find.

In this adventure, a team of dwarvish prospectors and spelunkers in the deepest reaches of the Emerald Mountain find the remains of a strange temple-like structure. The place was ancient enough that most of it had been reclaimed by the mountain through seismic movements. Hundreds of glowing quartz-crystal formations emerged from the floor, walls, and unstable ceilings in this area. The crystals had an enrapturing quality that left the dwarvish prospectors in awe. They packed their pockets and sacks with as many of the precious stones they could and kept moving forward as the mysterious crystals grew larger and more complex the further and deeper they went. The strange happenings were the demise of the dwarves. When the characters reach this place, they shall find great treasures and great dangers when they behold what happened to the miner dwarves.

boardgame.name: Lair of the Mind Eater
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is our 24th installment of the one-page dungeon series. The objective is to create self-contained adventures/dungeons with all things necessary to spawn fun adventures on a single page. It is system neutral so it can be easily ported to any system. It shouldn't be much trouble to include it in any medieval setting.

Deserts are some of the most dangerous places for travelers and adventurers. The weather is not the only hazard they must overcome; indigenous wildlife hides under the very sand. The case of the hard-to-reach Coppersand Desert is no different. The desert owes its name to the extremely hot temperatures that manage to melt and fuse the dunes.

Life has not been the same at Coppersand Desert for a few months now. The people from the few villages near the desert have witnessed strange lights coming from the dunes’ depths but do not know much further. It is said that an ancient pyramid marks the center of Coppersand Desert but these rumors have not been confirmed. It is too dangerous and expensive to travel there only to verify a myth. No one has embarked on that journey out of mortal fear. The terrible creature that inhabits the pyramid causes terrible deadly dreams. It is time to put stop to this madness!

boardgame.name: The Golem Factory
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is our 25th installment of the one-page dungeon series. The objective is to create self-contained adventures/dungeons with all things necessary to spawn fun adventures on a single page. It is system neutral so it can be easily ported to any system. It shouldn't be much trouble to include it in any medieval setting.

Binding rituals are an evil form of magic that traps a soul inside a body or object. The soul is used as a magical battery; a form of energy that slowly but surely is consumed. Subjects of this incantation are stripped from their power. They are nothing but a medium of energy. Some binding masters use elemental entities in this way and bind them to constructs. The worst of them bind people’s souls to magical constructs.

An evil mage who goes by the name of Lord Artghast has perfected the art of stripping a living person of their soul and embedding it into the inanimate body of a carefully prepared golem. Lord Artghast has built a factory of sorts under his manor for this purpose. So far, over a dozen poor townsfolk have gone missing. The wicked mage lures them into his lair with charms and deceits. Then he traps them in the depths of his golem factory for future use in his sinister arcane activities. The locals offer a hefty reward to adventurers to retrieve their captured loved ones. There must be a way to save them all from the evil mage.

boardgame.name: First in Flight
boardgame.description:
First in Flight is a push-your-luck, deck-building game about the race to early flight. Players take on the roles of the Wright Brothers, Samuel Langley, and other flight pioneers, racing to build and pilot the “flyers” that preceded modern airplanes.

Each player’s flyer design is represented by a deck of cards that they can steadily improve and refine, and which may include unknown design flaws that threaten their success.

Flying is a blackjack-style challenge to test a design, break new records, and gain experience -- hopefully without crashing. Then, players head back to the workshop to refine their flyers and improve their chances on future flights. There are dozens of available technologies, pilot skills, and friends in the field available for players to customize their own play style and strategy.

boardgame.name: Foundations of Rome: Neoprene Play Mat
boardgame.description: Kickstarter Exclusive Neoprene Play Mat for Foundations of Rome Board Game by Arcane Wonders. Includes Extra Large 3' x 5' neoprene play mat. Requires Foundations of Rome core game to play (sold separately).

Swamp Wargame Scatter is part of the Wildlands wilderness terrain series. It is made of "Dwarvenite" and includes some metal and magnetized parts. This item was initially available as a pledge level during the Wildlands Kickstarter. The item comes in both painted and unpainted versions.

boardgame.name: Blood Bowl: Norse Team Norsca Rampagers
boardgame.description:
Nordic teams love a good fight above all else - and that's certainly what they do best on the field! The Nordiques spend their entire lives in the cold north, which makes them very tough. These hardened players excel at scrimmaging, making blocks in all directions as they punch their way into the end zone - and presumably the tavern just beyond!

Of course, it's not just about causing a midfield brawl; there's also that crucial detail of scoring touchdowns. The Nordic teams work best when they can use their generous fighting skills to punch a hole in the opponent's defense, so that their Valkyries can use their impressive speed to get through and win.

This kit consists of 120 plastic pieces with which you can assemble the Norsca Rampagers, a Nordic team to use in your Blood Bowl matches. The team consists of 6 Norse Raider Linemen, 2 Beer Boar, 2 Norse Berserkers, 2 Ulfwereners and 2 Valkyries. It also includes 2 double-sided Blood Bowl pieces, 2 turn and raise counters, 4 balloons, and a sheet of 292 decals.

These figures come unpainted and require assembly.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Blood Bowl: Norse Team Pitch & Dugouts
boardgame.description:
There are few grand stadia in Norsca, for most of the Blood Bowl pitches in that icy land are loosely constructed on fjords, frozen lakes, or wind-battered tundra. Playing in such hostile conditions presents many unique dangers to Blood Bowl players – from spectacularly skidding and face-planting on the frigid pitch, to falling through the ice itself!

Players will need to tread carefully on this dangerous skating rink, or risk the chilling waters below. The Frozen Lake pitch has two sides – one depicting the pitch in fair weather, with the lake covered in a thick sheet of ice. The other side depicts the pitch after some disaster or another has caused the ice to break apart, exposing the freezing waters below.

You'll also find a pair of matching double-sided dugouts to complete the theme. Each dugout features score, turn, and re-roll trackers, plus Reserves, Knocked-out, and Casualty boxes.

Rules for using each side of the pitch in your games of Blood Bowl are included.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Blood Bowl: Norse Team Card Pack
boardgame.description:
Don't miss a beat on the pitch! This deck of 44 cards will help you keep track of stats and profiles for your Norse team, as well as positions and Star Players. It also includes Special Play cards exclusively for use with Norse teams.

CONTENTS
6x Player Reference cards for the Ulfwerener, Berserker, Valkyrie, Beer Boar, Norse Raider Lineman, and Yhetee
3x Star Player cards for Ivar Eriksson, Skrog Snowpelt, and Thorsson Stoutmead
8x Magical Memorabilia Special Play cards
8x Heroic Feats Special Play cards
18x Blank Positional Cards, to fill in for each player on your team: 9x Norse Raider Lineman, 2x Ulfwerener, 2x Berserker, 2x Valkyrie, 2x Beer Boar, and x1 Yhetee
One all-important card that explains how to use all of the above cards, with a red card on the reverse

You'll need a copy of Blood Bowl – The Official Rules and Spike! Journal Issue 14 to make full use of these cards.

-description from publisher's website
